overview:
Helge Brzoska is an experienced marketing/pr, business development and branding expert who started his career in the publishing industry. His first position was adsales for a nationwide university magazine in Germany. After having successfully started one of the first german online-recruitment platforms in connection with a real-life recruiting fair in Frankfurt in the late 90s, he decided to make a second start in the field of enterprise IT where he spent the next 10 years. Again the first position was sales / account management in the field of enterprise search, where he soon began to collect a track record of renowned clients in the industry, automotive and banking sector, serving clients like Siemens or Deutsche Telekom and Bertelsmann. 2005/06 he then lead the business development and Marketing of 100 DAYS Software Projects - better known as the later german Service Department of Zend Technologies, the inventors of PHP. 2006-2009 he helped brox IT-Solutions, a german Software company to open-source its enterprise search framework “eccenca” in a joint-development project together with Bertelsmann subsidiary empolis at Eclipse Foundation (project-name: SMILA).

After a failed startup-experience as CCO at kinkon.de (internet-security for kids) and more than two years creative direction and unit-lead with a team of seven at a well-known german advertising agency (clients include Volkswagen, mia electric car brand launch plus two german premier league football-clubs) he nowadays supports german collaboration-software veterans unoso GmbH & Co. KG with the launch of their social collaboration software product brand, which is in closed beta right now (Aug 2012).
